title: Brown heath and blue bells :
author: Winter, William
snippet: Through Wamphrey, Dinwoodie, Netherscleugh, and Ecclefechan, onward I speed, and so, across a long stretch of level green country, much variegated with hedge-rows and strips of woodland, I come to the Eden, and see the villas on its sunny banks, and the great square cathedral tower, and the red and gray buildings of antique Carlisle.
